description: A critical permit for an offshore wind farm planned near the New Jersey Shore has been invalidated by an administrative appeals board, seven weeks after President Donald Trump declared he hoped the project was “dead and gone.”
title: Permit for Offshore Wind Farm Voided After Trump Opposed Project

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said South Africa’s ambassador to the US “is no longer welcome” in the country after the top envoy made comments about President Donald Trump, escalating a running feud between Washington and Pretoria.
title: Rubio Says South Africa Envoy Is ‘Persona Non Grata,’ Fueling Feud

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer called on Western nations to ramp up economic pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin if he delays a ceasefire in Ukraine, as he prepared to host a fresh round of discussions with like-minded leaders about securing a truce.
title: UK Urges Economic Pressure on Russia If Putin Balks at Truce

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is withdrawing the nomination of Adam Boehler to be its top envoy for hostage issues, but he will continue to deal with those matters as a special government employee, according to the White House.
title: Trump’s Nomination of Hostage Envoy Pulled After Hamas Meeting

description: Canadian Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Mark Carney should have been fired when he was governor of the Bank of England, arguing that the new Canadian prime minister’s economic record isn’t as strong as he presents it.
title: Poilievre Takes Shot at Carney’s Record, Saying He Failed at Bank of England

description: Ex-Sen. Richard Burr is mounting a comeback to Capitol Hill – as a registered lobbyist for Duke University and other clients reeling from threats of Elon Musk’s DOGE federal funding cuts.
title: Ex-Sen. Burr Turns Lobbyist Pitching for Home-State Colleges, AI

description: The Senate moved forward with a Republican spending plan in a crucial vote that effectively swept away the threat of a US government shutdown while exacerbating a furious struggle within the Democratic party over how to confront Donald Trump’s audacious expansion of presidential power.
title: Senate Clears Way for GOP Spending Bill as Shutdown Threat Ebbs

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump at Justice Department Vows to Investigate the Investigators

description: Vice President JD Vance said he expected President Donald Trump to wrap up a deal for TikTok and keep the popular video-sharing app operating in the US ahead of a deadline next month.
title: Vance Tells NBC ‘High-Level’ TikTok Deal Expected by Deadline

description: President Donald Trump said he would seek to scrap a plan to move the Federal Bureau of Investigation headquarters from Washington, DC to Maryland, and instead keep it in the nation’s capital — the latest in a long-running saga over the site for the agency’s main office.
title: Trump Says He’ll Keep FBI in DC, Scrap Plan to Move to Maryland

description: Arizona Senator Mark Kelly, a former Space Shuttle commander who used to work with Elon Musk’s SpaceX, has ditched his black Tesla Model S after publicly feuding with the world’s richest person in recent weeks.
title: Senator Mark Kelly Ditches His Tesla After Elon Musk Calls Him a Traitor

description: David Sacks, President Donald Trump’s adviser for artificial intelligence and cryptocurrencies, and his venture-capital firm Craft Ventures have divested more than $200 million worth of holdings related to the digital-asset industry, according to a memo released by the White House.
title: Trump Crypto Czar Sacks Sells Over $200 Million in Investments

description: A staffer for the Department of Government Efficiency violated Treasury Department policies when he sent a spreadsheet containing personal information to two other people in the Trump administration, a federal official revealed in a court filing Friday.
title: DOGE Staffer Broke Treasury Rules in Transmitting Personal Data

description: Boeing Co. and US prosecutors said they’re still working to finalize a revised deal to settle a criminal case against the planemaker stemming from two fatal 737 Max crashes, three months after an earlier plan was blocked by a judge because it included a provision related to diversity, equity and inclusion.
title: Boeing Says Its Still Working on Plea Deal with DOJ Over 737 Max Crashes

description: The US Senate confirmed billionaire Stephen Feinberg to be second in charge at the Pentagon, where the private equity investor promised to fix longstanding issues.
title: Billionaire Stephen Feinberg Is Confirmed as Pentagon Deputy Secretary

description: Senior members of the European Union’s executive arm and US officials spoke on Friday to explore ways to move forward after US President Donald Trump’s metals tariffs prompted a trade war.
title: US, EU Officials Explore How to Move Forward in Trump’s Trade War

description: US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard launched a formal investigation into leaks and widened a probe into the chatrooms and information-sharing platforms used by the intelligence community, her office said Friday.
title: Gabbard Announces Probe Into US Intelligence Community Leaks

description: At a Canadian mountain retreat, some of the US’s closest allies tried to divine over private conversations and public interactions where Secretary of State Marco Rubio really stands vis-a-vis his boss.
title: At G-7 Meeting, US Allies’ Top Diplomats Wonder Where Rubio Stands

description: President Donald Trump is set to meet with top oil executives at the White House next week as he charts plans to stoke domestic energy production, even as the industry grows uneasy about falling crude prices and tariff uncertainty.
title: Trump Set to Meet Oil Titans on Energy Production Amid Trade War

description: The Netherlands is set to implement sweeping budget cuts across central government while exploring the use of artificial intelligence in an attempt to boost government efficiency.
title: Dutch Government Bets on €1 Billion Cuts, AI to Boost Efficiency

description: Marc Lasry, the billionaire co—founder of Avenue Capital Group, said the uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s policies, particularly on tariffs, is stalling investors looking to take advantage of market opportunities.
title: Marc Lasry Says Economy ‘Can’t Survive’ Under Trump Uncertainty

description: Mexican financial officials and the country’s banks have assured US authorities they’ll be willing partners in President Donald Trump’s crackdown on drug gangs. The complexity of the task casts some doubt on those guarantees.
title: Mexico’s Assurances on Cartels Collide With Compliance Onslaught

description: Nancy Pelosi flexed her political muscle Friday, taking a swipe at Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer after he walked back a threat to force Republicans to negotiate or risk a US government shutdown.
title: Pelosi Comes Out Against Schumer’s Government Shutdown Retreat

description: Russia’s Vladimir Putin and Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro pledged to sign energy, military and financial deals, when they spoke on a live video call on Friday.
title: Putin and Maduro Speak on Video Call, Pledge ‘Strategic Deals’

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the situation in the Kursk region was “very difficult” after Russian forces moved quickly in recent days to reclaim the land that Kyiv’s military captured in August’s incursion.
title: Zelenskiy Says Situation in Kursk Region Is ‘Very Difficult’

description: Norway’s Trade Minister Cecilie Myrseth met with European Union officials as the Nordic country seeks an exemption to any broad protective tariff the bloc could levy as a response to a US initiated trade war.
title: Norway’s Trade Minister Myrseth Works to Win EU Tariff Exemption

description: Mehmet Oz, President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead Medicare and Medicaid, told senators he would focus on chronic disease and improving the efficiency of federal health programs.
title: Dr. Oz Declines to Oppose Medicaid Cuts During Senate Hearing

description: The Dutch government announced it could either not agree with or abstain from voting on parts of the European Union’s latest defense spending proposals.
title: Dutch Consider Abstaining from Vote on EU Defense Finance Plans

description: Mark Carney has been sworn in as Canada’s 24th prime minister, bringing the former central banker to power in the middle of an explosive trade war with the US.
title: Carney Sworn In as Canada Leader With Trade Ruling Agenda

description: Germany’s top court rejected emergency bids to prevent the nation’s outgoing parliament from racing ahead with changes to the constitution to remove limits on defense borrowing and set up a €500 billion ($544 billion) infrastructure fund.
title: Germany’s Top Court Rejects Attempts to Stop Debt-Brake Vote

description: Local leaders across the DC metro area are raising alarms about a stopgap measure in Congress that would trigger a $1 billion budget shortfall for the city.
title: Washington, DC, Region Braces for ‘Devastating’ Cuts from Congress

description: Group of Seven foreign ministers have reached consensus on a joint statement calling for more sanctions on Russia if it doesn’t agree to a ceasefire.
title: G-7 Nixes ‘Two-State Solution’ to Push Through Communique

description: Former Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte appeared before the International Criminal Court on Friday for the first time since his arrest for alleged crimes against humanity committed during his deadly war on drugs.
title: Philippines’ Duterte Faces Criminal Court for First Time After Arrest

description: Francois-Phillipe Champagne will be named as Canada’s new finance minister when Mark Carney takes over as prime minister on Friday, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Carney Taps Champagne as Finance Minister in Trade War Strategy

description: President Donald Trump appealed to Russian President Vladimir Putin to spare the lives of thousands of Ukrainian troops he said were in a “very bad and vulnerable position” and avoid what he said would be a massacre unlike anything since World War II.
title: Trump Asks Russia to Spare Lives of Surrounded Ukraine Troops

description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s failure to install a fellow vaccine critic to a key government post is testing the limits of how far the US health secretary can go to promote his public-health agenda.
title: RFK Jr.’s First Big Defeat on CDC Chief Tests Limits of Vaccine Agenda

description: Guatemala quiere ayudar a sus deportados, pero el discurso del presidente de EE.UU. hace que algunos se muestren reacios a ayudar.
title: Estrategia de Trump de tachar a migrantes de delincuentes complica planes para traerlos de vuelta

description: Alan K. Simpson, the three-term Republican US senator from Wyoming who worked with Democrats to overhaul federal immigration law in 1986 and lead a deficit-reduction commission in 2010, has died. He was 93.
title: Alan K. Simpson, Acerbic Yet Approachable US Senator, Dies at 93

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz reached an agreement with the Green party on a debt-funded spending package for defense and infrastructure, overcoming a key hurdle ahead of a crunch vote in parliament next week.
title: Merz Reaches Deal With Greens on German Spending Package

description: Guatemala quiere ayudar a sus deportados, pero el discurso del presidente de EE.UU. hace que algunos se muestren reacios a ayudar.
title: Estrategia de Trump de tachar a migrantes de delincuentes complica planes para traerlos de vuelta

description: Columbia University, facing demands from the Trump administration that it respond more forcefully to antisemitism on campus, said that federal agents searched two university residences on Thursday night.
title: Columbia Must Meet Trump Demands for Funds, Free Press Says

description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said relations with Russia should eventually be normalized once the fighting ends in Ukraine.
title: NATO Chief Says Russia Relations Should Be Restored After War

description: Guatemala wants to help returning migrants prepare for a new life, but the US president’s rhetoric around the people being sent back is making some locals reluctant to help.
title: Trump Branding Migrants as Criminals Is Complicating Plans to Bring Them Home

description: Hamas said it was ready to release a living American hostage and four bodies, though it was unclear if the US and Israeli governments sought such a move and whether they would accept it unconditionally.
title: Hamas Says It Agreed to Release US-Israeli Hostage, Four Bodies

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz reached a tentative agreement with the Green party on a debt-funded spending package for defense and infrastructure, people familiar with the discussions said.
title: Merz Said to Reach Tentative Deal With Greens on German Debt

description: Germany’s chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz reached an agreement with the Greens party on a fiscal reform package for large investments on infrastructure and defense, according to a report by newspaper Handelsblatt.
title: Merz Reaches Deal With Greens on German Debt, Handelsblatt Says

description: President Donald Trump’s vision of protecting the US with a “Golden Dome” missile-defense system drew more than 360 company concept papers that Pentagon analysts are studying as they rush to come up with a workable plan as early as the next fiscal year.
title: Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’ System Spurs Flood of Defense Industry Pitches

description: US executives are trying to soothe concerns that the Department of Government Efficiency’s contract-slashing spree might hurt profits, saying a modernized public sector is more likely to adopt their tools and services.
title: US Companies Tell Investors DOGE Cuts Will Ultimately Pay Off

description: Justin Trudeau is out. Mark Carney is in. And his arrival as Canada’s new leader creates an opening for the government in Ottawa to reset its tense relationship with the US and President Donald Trump.
title: Carney Takes Power in Canada as Nation Seeks Answers to Trump’s Aggression

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Strains Ties With Europe’s Key US Ally Poland

description: Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing has raised Beijing’s ire by agreeing to sell its control over ports in Panama to appease President Donald Trump. But there may be little the Chinese authorities can do to punish him for it.
title: Li Ka-shing Has Little to Lose as China Threatens Panama Deal

description: As former Philippine leader Rodrigo Duterte rallied supporters in Hong Kong on Sunday, his team seemed unconcerned about rumors that the International Criminal Court might soon issue an arrest warrant against him.
title: Duterte’s Swift Descent From ‘Punisher’ President to ICC Inmate

description: Greece’s Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis unveiled a broad cabinet reshuffle Friday as he seeks to shore up his government following major protests over its handling of the deadliest train crash in the nation’s history.
title: Greek Premier Reshuffles Cabinet After Protests, Censure Motion

description: Firing federal workers and freezing grants are upending a world-class system the US has built since World War II.
title: Trump’s Science Cuts Have Thrown the Research World Into Chaos

description: Representative Byron Donalds will introduce legislation on Friday to codify an executive order that President Donald Trump signed earlier this month that establishes a strategic Bitcoin reserve and US digital asset stockpile.
title: Digital Asset Legislation Pushed as Trump Embraces Crypto Agenda

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz said he was “very optimistic” that a landmark debt-spending package will be approved after a parliamentary debate on Thursday laid bare a deep rift with the Greens, whose support he needs.
title: Merz ‘Very Optimistic’ German Debt Package Will Be Approved

description: Drones attacked Moscow for the second time in a week with at least one hitting a central area not far from government buildings, as Russian news services reported US special envoy Steve Witkoff’s plane had left the country following talks.
title: Ukraine Hits Moscow With Drones After US Envoy Traveled to Putin

description: The deal won't be a burden on Putin as much as a hard choice for the US.
title: The Ukraine Ceasefire Will Test US Intentions Most of All

description: Greenland’s acting prime minister invited local party leaders to a meeting to draft a joint spurning of Donald Trump’s latest approach to take over the Arctic island.
title: Greenland Premier Seeks Joint Rejection of Latest Trump Advance

description: Hungary is ready to shoulder financing for Europe’s defense ambitions but it opposes using joint European Union debt to do so, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.
title: Hungary to Oppose Joint EU Defense Financing, Premier Orban Says

description: Ukrainian drone attacks triggered a massive fuel tank fire at Rosneft PJSC’s Tuapse oil refinery, one of the biggest in Russia.
title: Russia Says Drone Attack Causes Fire at Tuapse Oil Refinery

description: China, Russia and Iran called for an end to sanctions in nuclear talks hosted by Beijing, days after Tehran spurned US President Donald Trump’s call for negotiations.
title: Iran, China Call to End Curbs After Tehran Spurned Trump Talks

description: Eight months after Labour’s landslide victory, Bloomberg examines if the UK government is on track to meet key election pledges.
title: Starmer’s Battle on the Home Front: Is Labour Delivering on Its Promises?

description: The country is emblematic of demographic challenges facing Eastern Europe — the region experiencing the world’s fastest population decline.
title: Croatia Looks to Buck Europe’s Sharp Drop in Birth Rates

description: We probably won’t see oil-slicked seabirds this time, but that doesn’t mean damage hasn’t been done.
title: Preventing the North Sea Collision From Echoing Deepwater

description: Greece could be about to rid itself of the last vestiges of its debt crisis with a credit upgrade that would lift it conclusively out of the junk territory it entered 15 years ago.
title: Greek Rating Upgrade Offers Path to Debt-Crisis Closure

description: Thailand wants to wrap up talks with the European Union on a long-awaited free trade deal by the end of the year as it seeks to reinforce economic security amid potential tariff risks from the US, an official said.
title: Thailand Eyes EU Free Trade Deal By Year End Amid US Tariff Risk

description: Xiaomi Corp., Geely Automobile Holdings Ltd., NIO Inc. and Xpeng Inc. will show how resilient China’s electric-vehicle sector is to a stagnant domestic economy and tariffs in the US and European Union.
title: Xiaomi, Geely, China EV Makers to Show Resilience Despite Tariffs

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned that an escalation of disputes over trade levies kicked off by US President Donald Trump may have a detrimental effect on the world economy.
title: ECB’s Lagarde Warns of Severe Global Fallout From a Trade War

description: The growth of Japan’s GDP may sound like good news for the country, but it also means it will have to pay more to reach its target to spend 2% of GDP on defense, adding to the woes of a nation already under pressure from US President Donald Trump to boost its military output.
title: Japan’s GDP Growth Imperils 2% Defense Spending Target

description: Vietnam’s top trade official Nguyen Hong Dien, looking to protect the country from possible Trump tariffs, told US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer his country is developing measures to ensure “sustainable” economic relations between the two countries.
title: Vietnam’s Trade Minister Meets US Trade Chief Amid Tariff Fears

description: Canada’s top ministers said the country’s change of leadership may provide a chance to “reset” its now troubled relationship with the US, its biggest trading partner.
title: Canada’s New Leader Could Reset Strained US Ties, Ministers Say

description: China’s top office on Hong Kong issues reposted a sharp attack on CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. for agreeing to sell a controlling stake in Panama ports, warning companies to be very careful about which “side they should stand on.”
title: China Amplifies Rebuke of Li Ka-shing’s Panama Port Deal With BlackRock

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba confirmed that he distributed gift vouchers to 15 lawmakers, raising questions about whether he skirted political funding laws and casting another cloud over his already weak position as support for his minority government sags.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Admits Handing Out Gift Vouchers to Lawmakers

description: The UK announced it would provide loans totaling £2 billion ($2.6 billion) to allied governments to buy from British defense companies, the latest move by a European nation to boost investment in military capabilities under pressure from President Donald Trump.
title: UK Boosts Defense Firms With £2 Billion Loans for Allies
